intro: Fagraea teysmanii, commonly known as the white-flowered starwood, is a tropical evergreen tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Meliaceae and is characterized by its dense, glossy green foliage and showy white flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant produces small, round, red berries that are edible but have a bitter taste. It thrives in humid, shady environments and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a landscape plant.
